title: Generalization in the Face of Adaptivity: A Bayesian Perspective. (arXiv:2106.10761v2 [cs.LG] UPDATED)
abstract: Repeated use of a data sample via adaptively chosen queries can rapidly lead to overfitting, wherein the empirical evaluation of queries on the sample significantly deviates from their mean with respect to the underlying data distribution. It turns out that simple noise addition algorithms suffice to prevent this issue, and differential privacy-based analysis of these algorithms shows that they can handle an asymptotically optimal number of queries. translated_title: 面对适应性泛化：贝叶斯视角下的研究
translated_abstract: 自适应选择样本可能导致过度拟合，简单的噪声加算法可以避免这一问题。本文证明了噪声加算法可以提供不依赖于查询规模的误差保证，这一结果来源于更好地理解自适应数据分析的核心问题。我们表明适应数据分析的问题在于新查询与过去查询的协方差。
tldr: 本文提出面对自适应选择数据样本引起的过度拟合问题，使用噪声加算法可以提供不依赖于查询规模的误差保证，这一结果表明适应数据分析的问题在于新查询与过去查询的协方差。
en_tdlr: This paper addresses the issue of overfitting caused by adaptive sample selection, and shows that simple noise addition algorithms can provide variance-dependent guarantees that do not depend on the size of queries. The problem with adaptive data analysis is shown to be the covariance between new queries and previous queries.
